subclassFeature.name: Chronokeeper
entries: You have focused your training in the ancient arts of Chronomancy - Time Magic. Although similar to Arcane Tricksters, Chronokeepers learn a very limited spectrum of magic, rather than the expanse of enchantment and illusion spells learned by an Arcane Trickster. These rogues include only the most well trained spies, assassins, and adventurers.

subclassFeature.name: Chronokeeper Exploits
entries: You learn certain Exploits at the rogue levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Exploits Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Foresight
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls, and you cannot be surprised whenever you are conscious.

subclassFeature.name: Time Step
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to leap back to where you were a few seconds ago. As long as you are not incapacitated, restrained, or grappled, you can use your reaction to instantly teleport back to where you started your last turn when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you.
You may do this as a reaction whenever you wish if you use this ability outside of combat. If you do so, you go to where you were 6 seconds ago.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden in Time
entries: Starting at 7th Level, whenever you use your Time Step feature you can also make a Dexterity (Stealth) check as part of the same action. In order to succeed on this check you must still meet all of the normal qualifications to hide.

subclassFeature.name: Temporal Shift
entries: At 13th Level, you can cast the spells Haste and Slow, using your Intelligence as your spellcasting ability for these spells. Each of these spells can be cast once with this feature, and you regain the ability to cast them this way once you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Time Lapse
entries: When you reach 17th level, you have become a master of manipulating time. You can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to re-apply all of the damage that you dealt since the start of your turn, doubling the damage you dealt in total.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
